channel.title: Comments on: Review of the Oraimo Power Bank Series – Things to Know Before Buying One
channel.description: Web × Design; Branditechture is an hybrid creative design agency.

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1695">Okwuchukwu</a>.
Yes, charge it full before first use.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Okwuchukwu.

Yes, charge it full before first use.

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1474">Onome Anthony</a>.
Not true. Use a laptop USB-C Charger and you'd be surprised.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Onome Anthony.

Not true. Use a laptop USB-C Charger and you’d be surprised.

item.title: By: Onome Anthony
item.dc:creator: Onome Anthony
item.description: Hello, I recently bought the Oraimo Opb-p208dn (pilot byte 20,000mAh led display) and since I got it, I tried charging to 100 before using but it never goes past 99. I've tried all kinds of charger. Someone said maybe the display is just 2 figures and 99 is the highest. Kindly confirm pls.
item.content:encoded:
Hello,
I recently bought the Oraimo Opb-p208dn (pilot byte 20,000mAh led display) and since I got it, I tried charging to 100 before using but it never goes past 99.
I’ve tried all kinds of charger.
Someone said maybe the display is just 2 figures and 99 is the highest.
Kindly confirm pls.

item.title: By: Victoria John
item.dc:creator: Victoria John
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1445">Richie</a>.
Locate any oraimo service center, they may help with a replacement or solution. You can also try tagging or texting them on X formerly known as Twitter.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Richie.

Locate any oraimo service center, they may help with a replacement or solution. You can also try tagging or texting them on X formerly known as Twitter.

item.title: By: Richie
item.dc:creator: Richie
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1438">Yusuf Odukoya</a>.
I have same problem as him but my power bank is barely 2 month. It took about 70% to fully charge a 3,000MaH battery. A 40,000MaH Oriamo Power bank.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Yusuf Odukoya.

I have same problem as him but my power bank is barely 2 month. It took about 70% to fully charge a 3,000MaH battery. A 40,000MaH Oriamo Power bank.

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1429">Adachukwu</a>.
If you can locate any oraimo service center, they may help with a replacement. You can also try messaging them on Twitter or X.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Adachukwu.

If you can locate any oraimo service center, they may help with a replacement. You can also try messaging them on Twitter or X.

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/oraimo-power-bank-series/#comment-1428">Kelvin Joseph</a>.
It's normal for power banks to lose storage capacity with time, but it depends on what you use it for. Also, to reduce the time needed for a full charge, I would recommend using a high-wattage USB-C.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kelvin Joseph.

It’s normal for power banks to lose storage capacity with time, but it depends on what you use it for. Also, to reduce the time needed for a full charge, I would recommend using a high-wattage USB-C.
